subject: Career
title: The First 90 Days in a New Career
description: A short lesson to help you apply The First 90 Days in a New Career.

hook.text: Michael Watkins' research: the first 90 days determine whether a new hire succeeds or fails.

buildup.text: In a new career, you're simultaneously learning the role, the culture, the tools, and the language.

discovery.text: The strategy: listen more than talk, find quick wins, and identify the key stakeholders early.

twist.text: Career changers often overcompensate by trying to prove themselves too fast. Patience beats performance theater.

climax.text: Set a 30-60-90 day plan: learn (30), contribute (60), lead small initiatives (90).

punchline.text: The first 90 days aren't about proving yourself. They're about learning the game.

quiz.question: What should career changers focus on in their first 90 days?
options: Listening, finding quick wins, and identifying key stakeholders
Proving they're the smartest in the room
